channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 17th October
item.description:
There are about 8 cones that have been let from the RUN Cheltenham event. They have contacted the organizers but they have not taken action. Can Highways help.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing sign (Parking) problem, 17th October
item.description:
Drivers are parking over the VDK on the junc of Hesters Way Road and Listening Post Close making it impossible to use with a mobility scooter. Can the parking be looked at? Or bollards put there big enough for a mobility scooter to get through but stop a car parking there?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The 98 bus stop at Chargrove Lane is very dangerous, there is no pavement to step onto, just a narrow verge of brambles, mud and nettles. Somebody will slip and fall under the bus, 17th October
item.description:
The location is just past the entrance to Chargrove Lane on the way to Gloucester. I am pleased to have this new bus service, but it is extremly dangerous for anyone who is unsteady on their feet who might hold on to the side of the bus to steady themselves. Urgent attention is needed before a serious accident happens
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Gravel and debris on cycle path, 17th October
item.description:
Along the new cycle path, there are multiple pockets of gravel and debris. From West Approach Drive up to the race course needs regular sweeping...gravel on a bike can be really hazardous. PLEASE can this be done perhaps once a week...like roads, cycle paths need to be maintained
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes in the turning circle at end of close, 17th October
item.description:
There are multiple potholes and areas of degraded tarmac in the turning circle at the end of Ashfield close. They are mostly at the edge of the road, but not all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashfield Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
